Title: Cingulate cortex of the Rhesus monkey: II. Cortical afferents
Comments: The data of figures 9A, 10B, and 10C were not entered into the database as it was not clear for these cases what exact area had been injected.

@BrainMaps.Comments: pp. 272-273: "The cytoarchitectural schemata of Brodmann (1909) and von Bonin & Bailey (1947) are used throughout this study. These schemes have been substantially amplified in recent years...The companion article [VPR87] to this one describes cingulate cortex cytoarchitecture. Additionally, some of the more recently published architectonic parcellations of specific cortical regions will also be used, including those for frontal (...Petrides and Pandya, 1984), and parietal (Pandya and Seltzer 1982) cortices, the superior temporal gyrus (Pandya and Sanides, 1973), and cortex of the superior temporal sulcus (Seltzer and Pandya, 1978)."

@BrainMaps_Delineation.Comments: pp. 272-273: "The cytoarchitectural schemata of Brodmann (1909) and von Bonin & Bailey (1947) are used throughout this study. These schemes have been substantially amplified in recent years...The companion article [VPR87] to this one describes cingulate cortex cytoarchitecture. Additionally, some of the more recently published architectonic parcellations of specific cortical regions will also be used, including those for frontal (...Petrides and Pandya, 1984), and parietal (Pandya and Seltzer 1982) cortices, the superior temporal gyrus (Pandya and Sanides, 1973), and cortex of the superior temporal sulcus (Seltzer and Pandya, 1978)."

@InterMapRelations.Comments: It is not completely clear whether VP87 use area PG as defined by BB47 or as delineated by PS82. As their other parietal areas obviously refer to the PS82 map, it seems likely that PG should refer to this scheme also.

@Injections.Citation: "...the injcetion involved area 25 below and rostral to the genu of the corpus callosum (Fig. 1)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: This article uses a confusing mixture of parcellation schemes. All used areas are included in the VP87 map within this database. Whenever findings are directly described by the text, they are described by areas of the VP87 map. As this report was obviously interested in all cortical afferents, the figures were also evaluated for (un)labelled areas not mentined by the text. These findings are described by using the various schemes the authors refer to (pp. 272-273), including PP84 (prefrontal), B09 (premotor, motor, sensory, parietal, occipital, temporal), BB47 (parahippocampal cortex) and SP78 (superior temporal sulcus).

@Injections.Citation: "Figure 2 presents a second cingulate case in which the HRP injection was mainly in areas 24a and 24b with slight infringement on areas 24c and 32."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: This article uses a confusing mixture of parcellation schemes. All used areas are included in the VP87 map within this database. Whenever findings are directly described by the text, they are described by areas of the VP87 map. As this report was obviously interested in all cortical afferents of cingulate cortex, the figures were also evaluated for (un)labelled areas not mentined by the text. These findings are described by using the various schemes the authors refer to (pp. 272-273), including PP84 (prefrontal), B09 (premotor, motor, sensory, parietal, occipital, temporal), BB47 (parahippocampal cortex) and SP78 (superior temporal sulcus).

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: This article uses a confusing mixture of parcellation schemes. All used areas are included in the VP87 map within this database. Whenever findings are directly described by the text, they are described by areas of the VP87 map. As this report was obviously interested in all cortical afferents of cingulate cortex, the figures were also evaluated for (un)labelled areas not mentined by the text. These findings are described by using the various schemes the authors refer to (pp. 272-273), including PP84 (prefrontal), B09 (premotor, motor, sensory, parietal, occipital, temporal), BB47 (parahippocampal cortex) and SP78 (superior temporal sulcus).

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: This article uses a confusing mixture of parcellation schemes. All used areas are included in the VP87 map within this database. Whenever findings are directly mentioned by the text, they are described by areas of the VP87 map. (Un)labelled cingulate areas and labelled non-cingulate areas not described by the text but shown by the figures are described by using the maps that this article refers to (unlabelled non-cingulate areas are not described as it is unclear to what extent the figure of this case depicts label in other than cingulate areas).

@Injections.Citation: "An injection into medial area 7 or PGm..." (p. 281)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: Information on laminar patterns (p. 281): "...the predominant label was over layer I and less was over layers II and III. In these cases there was also substantial label over layer IV." Fig. 11B, however, showa label in infragranular layers also. It remains unclear, whether this label represents terminals or is located in vertically ascending axons. Therefore, the code 322X00 for describing the general laminar pattern was chosen.
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: This article uses a confusing mixture of parcellation schemes. All used areas are included in the VP87 map within this database. @LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: Information on laminar patterns: "In terms of laminar termination, grains were observed mainly over layers I-IIIa with lesser amounts in layer IV." (p. 281).
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: This article uses a confusing mixture of parcellation schemes. All used areas are included in the VP87 map within this database. Whenever findings are directly described by the text, they are described by areas of the VP87 map. As this report was obviously interested in all cortical afferents, the figures were also evaluated for (un)labelled areas not mentioned by the text: "The locations of autoradiographic grains are shown on the entire medial surface...". The information of the figures is described by using the various schemes the authors refer to (pp. 272-273), including PP84 (prefrontal), B09 (premotor, motor, sensory, parietal, occipital, temporal), BB47 (parahippocampal cortex) and SP78 (superior temporal sulcus).

@Injections.Citation: "A more caudal injection that involved mainly area TL (Fig. 9B)..."
@Injections.Comments: Neither text nor figures clearly indicate whether the injection was entirely restricted to area TL, or whether any neighbouring area was also affected.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: Information on laminar patterns: "...terminals were labeled over layer I, fewer were labeled in layers II and III, and the fewest were labeled in layer IV." (p. 281)
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: This article uses a confusing mixture of parcellation schemes. All used areas are included in the VP87 map within this database. Whenever findings are directly mentioned by the text, they are described by areas of the VP87 map. (Un)labelled cingulate areas not described by the text but shown by the figures are described by using the VPR87 map (other unlabelled areas are not described as the figures of this case seem not to depict label in other than cingulate areas).

publication.title: Cingulate cortex of the Rhesus monkey: II. Cortical afferents
